title.rendered: Lindsay Lohan Walks Away From Bill

content.rendered:
Reading Time: < 1 minute

Mean Girls may have been more than a movie title – it may have been type casting for Lindsay Lohan. The actress – who’s often mistaken for a tree branch – walked away from her latest film, Bill. Her reasoning? The movie’s first-time directors were not well known enough. Naturally.

Already in production, Bill also stars Aaron Eckhart and Amanda Peet. For some reason, those two actors had no problem with the individuals in charge of the set. Lohan will now concentrate on her next film, Georgia Rule, starring Jane Fonda and Felicity Huffman.

Apparently they’re famous enough to be in Lindsay’s company. A source told Fox News correspondent Roger Friedman, “She’s just going to stick to working with big-name directors now.”
